result.execSummary:
The defendant Veronica Castro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
*Pay supervision fees.
*No restitution set.

*NO contact with firearms.

*NO contact order remains in effect. The court will allow for 3rd party contact which should be approved by agent.

*Complete mental evaluation and cooperate with any treatment. Take medications.
*Attend parenting classes.
*Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
*Attend treatment and/or counseling as directed.
*Any other treatment as deemed appropriate by agent.

*AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
*Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Veronica Castro

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR COURT FEES RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS

denying request for release privileges.
Copy forwarded to defendant.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring and Huber.

Defendant Veronica Castro in court.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Veronica Castro in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are here for sentencing.  
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction with credit for 20 days served;  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 45 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and cooperate with any treatment.  Take medications.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact order remains in effect.  The court will allow for 3rd party contact which should be approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment and/or further her education.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- No restitution set.
- Any other treatment as deemed appropriate by agent.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Veronica Castro in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Bail Motion to address no contact order. Court allowed defendant to return to and have contact with 500 W. Arthur Ave #4 Milwaukee, WI. Case remains set for Sentencing on 8/6/2015 at 8:30 AM before branch 36.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Motion To Modify Conditions Bail To Allow Return To Home Address. Parties in court. Matter set for July 6th at 1:30 PM for a Bail Motion.

Defense counsel requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain in effect, unless determined to be allowed by Judge Flanagan. Br. 04 is handling the case where the victim of this matter appears as the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Veronica Castro in court with attorney Richard Thomey.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Status Conference. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court AMENDED Count 1 to REMOVE the Repeater (939.62(1)(a)) enhancer.

15RM026326  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-26-2015

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court, defendant Veronica Castro not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Case scheduled for 1:30 PM, called at 8:30 AM at request of defense counsel. Case adjourned for a Status Conference at defense request in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jose NC or Jose N

Defendant Veronica Castro in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Veronica Castro in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
